newsitem.title: USA: Alberto-Culver to post Q1 9.8 mln gain.
newsitem.headline: Alberto-Culver to post Q1 9.8 mln gain.

text.p: Alberto-Culver Co said Friday that insurance proceeds from the loss of its corporate airplane will result in a non-recurring net gain of $9.8 million in the first quarter of its 1997 fiscal year, which ends December 31, 1996.

Senior vice president of finance William Cernugel said the company received a $28 million insurance settlement on the plane, which was destroyed while taking off from Palwaukee airport in Wheeling, Ill., on October 30.
On a fully diluted basis, this amounts to $0.31 per share. On a primary basis, the gain will be $0.35 per share.
On a pretax basis, the non-recurring gain will be $15.6 million, Cernugel said in a statement.
Four people aboard the plane, including Alberto-Culver pilot Robert Whitener, were killed in the accident.
Alberto-Culver, a maker of hair care and beauty products, said it plans to replace the airplane as soon as possible.
